Detailed Description

An AZURE decay pair.

In AZURE, a Decay object represents a decay pair of the compound nucleus. The Decay object is keyed to a particle pair in the PPair vector, and serves as a container class for the KGroup and the KLGroup vectors and their subsequent reaction pathways.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

Decay::Decay ( int  pairNum  ) 

The Decay object is created with a reference to a particle pair number, which represents a position in the PPair vector.

int Decay::GetPairNum (  )  const

Returns the pair number of the decay.

int Decay::IsKGroup ( KGroup  a  ) 

Tests a specific combination to determine if it exists in the KGroup vector. If the combination exists, the position of the combination in the vector is returned. Otherwise, the function returns 0.

int Decay::IsKLGroup ( KLGroup  a  ) 

Tests a specific combination to determine if it exists in the KLGroup vector. If the combination exists, the position of the combination in the vector is returned. Otherwise, the function returns 0.

Returns the number of combinations in the KGroup vector.

Returns the number of combinations in the KLGroup vector.
